website_summaries.verdict: A resin liquid that can take on any shape designed for the 3D printer, and cures with UV light.
pros: Available in a range of vivid colors
Compatible with most DLP, LCD, and SLA printers
cons: Runny consistency, though some find it easier to clean up

customer_reviews.title: Very clear, fast curing.
customer_reviews.text: The bottle came packaged in a tight fitting air cushion inside a double walled box. No leaks unlike some other brands i have used. Cure times are virtually the same as wanhao and anycubic fast resins. Bed adhesion has been flawless and there's been no failed prints so far. The image i posted shows the clear with some pigments added to simulate a opal. Avoid washing in IPA to prevent clouding, instead use a detergent and ultra sonic cleaner but this holds true for all resins. For the best results cure with 385nm light to prevent yellowing and paint with a spray on clear gloss for a glass like finish.
customer_reviews.author: bootdsc

customer_reviews.title: Better than Anycubic brand!
customer_reviews.text: When I orginally purchased this resin, I was a bit worried switching from official Anycubic Photon Resin. Now after using this stuff, I am completely over the moon of the quality! I honestly prefer this to the Anycubic brand. If you are on the fence about switching, take a look at the provided pictures and maybe you will change your mind. Personally, I love to save money especially when I dont have to sacrifice quality! I will definitely be a return customer and I would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great performance and repeatability. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using the Anycubic Photon LCD printer. The thinness of the Elegoo resin allows good flow to the print area as opposed to thicker goopy resins. If you are running low in your vat, you are assured a better chance of using every last drop. The smell is better than many resins, and the price is great. Packaging is superior as I've never had leakage. The vertical shrinkage rate has been about 4%, but may be due to the slicer(?).
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kozik

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, great stuff. Worked really well in my Creality LD-001 printer.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas B. McKay

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Great results!
customer_reviews.text: The printing results of this resin speak for itself. The Batman bust was the first print with this resin and it came out flawlesly. Ive used other resins that have been very troublesome. Some require a lot of tweaking and trial and error with the settings. This stuff worked great right out of the box with no setting adjustments. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Garland

customer_reviews.title: I've been using nothing but Elegoo
customer_reviews.text: At the price they offer this resin, and at Amazon Prime shipping, it's a no brainer. I love this stuff. Not much odor and great results, especially on the grey. Use it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warning Color shift on light colors
customer_reviews.text: Did this resin print good? Yes it did, however that is only half the battle. This resin lacks the proper pigment stabilizers required to avoid color shift after exposure to uv light. Out of the chamber the print looked good however after curing the white turned a brown yellow color. You can see in the picture what white is supposed to be and what it actually looks like. Do yourself a favor and only buy black from this company and stick to higher quality brands for anything lighter
customer_reviews.author: M.C.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love the blue color. I use on a Sparkmaker and prints came out great! Planning on ordering Grey, Red, and White to give them a try as well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The ABS like is great!
customer_reviews.text: I used the ABS like red and it is much less rigid and brittle than standard resin. It performs more like a rigid TPU than abs. I tested the heat resistance and the hotter it gets the more brittle it becomes breaking at very low stress around 160 degrees C but once the part cools off it retains it original strength. Up to about 100 degrees C you won’t notice the effects. It can take quite a bit of strain before breaking. I wouldn’t consider it a strong material but it holds up for moderate stress mechanical parts. Still haven’t tested its long term UV resistance but I will update if I find anything interesting.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Resin darkens significantly during UV cure. Leaked in transport.
customer_reviews.text: This resin shipped quickly but when I received it, the bottle was slightly open and resin leached into the cardboard retail carton. The most disappointing part of this resin was how much it darkened during UV cure. Some reviewers noted slight yellowing but my prints went well past that to brown/orange. My intent was to shine color LED light through the resin so it's not unusable but the product is far from the white/clear frosted resin that I was expecting. The settings were a bit different from other resins I have been using but once I tweaked to the settings found in the other reviews, I had little issue getting prints to turn out.
customer_reviews.author: Tannyn

customer_reviews.title: The price bump kinda sucks
customer_reviews.text: So the product is pretty decent and was a good value at $22 for 500g of grey, however I have returned 3 weeks later to buy more and noticed the price has gone up to $27 & the 1000g to $44 which for me makes it less desirable. At that price Sculpt from Siraya tech seems to be a better value given the temperature resistance for essentially the same price. To be clear, I'd be a avid supporter at the original price.
customer_reviews.author: JLinhart

customer_reviews.title: Quality material
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Elegoo's resin for a few months now, and absolutely love it. I've only tried a few different colors (Black, Grey, Red and Transparent). So far I've noticed they all print with amazing detail, but the Grey seems to do the best. The odor isn't nearly as bad as some other brands, but you still want to be in a well ventilated room. The price seems to be pretty fair compared to other brands as well. I've also noticed that Elegoo's resin is pretty tough, even when handled roughly during post processing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. Cheaper then the big brands and after getting my printer set up with the right times I have been cranking out the minis. It is thinner then other resins but that works to your advantage when cleaning. It is soft when it’s fresh out of the printer but after the curing it’s hard and is ready to paint. I bought two bottles of grey and plan to buy more to try all the colors.
customer_reviews.author: M. Salazar Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Resin at a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through three bottles of the elegoo resin so far. They have all printed well and the odor is not overpowering. I found it's to be pretty forgiving with the settings and I'm currently printing with 10 bottom layers at 30 seconds and a normal exposure time of 6 1/2 seconds. Attached are some pictures of a chess set I am printing with the green and red elegoo resins. I would definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Ryanthetuner

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent quality, bad formulation.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 multi bottle orders of this resin and every order has varied radically in cure time and build-plate adhesion. This last batch was so resistant to curing that during production (even after raising the exposure time several seconds) the parts almost always pull away from the supports. I have increased exposure times to ridiculous levels and added many more supports but the parts come out of the machine soft and rubbery- this is a sign of bad formulation since the components are not properly reacting when exposed to UV light. I come from a chemical background (reactive polymers) so I know what I am talking about. This is simply poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: mommyof2

customer_reviews.title: Works Great in Wanhao D7
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my Wanhao D7. I use 40 seconds base cure, then 6 seconds for each layer. I was able to successfully print down to 20 microns, and the quality is amazing. Very easy to work with, the smell is low/average.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda V.

customer_reviews.title: Grey 'dries' with white edges
customer_reviews.text: While the prints look good right after printing, the grey resin has clear liquid on the prints, which 'dries' with white edges and spots and looks terrible. This happens whether you rinse the print in IPA or in water. This isn't an issue if you paint it, of course, but you can't display the prints as-is. I'm guessing that it might have to do with the grey pigment settling out of the resin during the hours-long printing process, but that's now nearly all resin printers work, so they really need to address it.
customer_reviews.author: Laird A. Popkin

customer_reviews.title: Resin is great! Smell not too strong as long as lid is on
customer_reviews.text: This resin makes great minis! The second photo is a bit washed out, but you can clearly see the mushrooms. This mini is your standard 28mm (1.1 in tall) and the details on it came out great! You can see the hair and every detail on these minis and once they are primed all the details pop. This resin cures in 10 min under cloudy conditions and is easy to clean using alcohol. I've seen a lot of reviews reporting terrible smells with resin. Isopropyl alcohol is far smellier than this resin. This isn't odorless by any means, but I feel safe enough to run this in a spare closed room. First model by Artisan Guild (2nd is HeroForge).
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: A most troubling yellow-orange color - not clear translucent
customer_reviews.text: The first photos are from the first print, wherein I did not have a long enough cure time set for the regular layers. About half what was recommended. After reading the spec sheet, my second attempt worked well. However, all the prints went from a nice clear to a quite noticeable yellow-orange color when cured in only sunlight. Overall, nice feature relief and hardness, but definitely not clear.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Gleason

customer_reviews.title: The best resin for miniatures by far
customer_reviews.text: The combination of this resin being extremely low odor, and flexible enough to throw the mini to the ground makes it a winner. This would be five star, but its claim that it only takes 8 seconds hasn't really panned out for me. I'm not certain if I'm doing it wrong, but I've had a lot of failed prints and parts of the print that seem to move or shift, and I'm already at 14 seconds. I'm using an Anycubic Photon, but I'm not sure that should matter because the tech is the same. Regardless of that, if your printing miniatures, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Hagala

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I keep on buying this and now have used over 100KG of the white in both my Anycubic Photon and EPAX X1s. I have compared Elegoo white to white from several other makers and the Elegoo was the best overall. Two other brands were faster exposure, but one of them was not solid enough of a white, and the other was fragile. The fact that the price is also the lowest is a huge bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Phönix

customer_reviews.title: if the price goes up there are better options. I print on a Photon at 70/12 ...
customer_reviews.text: using grey. Prints well for the price. As other mentioned, if the price goes up there are better options. I print on a Photon at 70/12 with good results. Seems to settle quickly, so make sure to stir/shake well before printing.
customer_reviews.author: Tori B

customer_reviews.title: This is not a new product apparently.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t rate performance. Haven’t used it yet. But what I can rate is the mildly deceptive description. I thought I was buying a new resin that was more flexible and tough that the standard translucent resin I was buying from Elegoo. What I received seems to be exactly the same product I was already using. What was the “ABS-like” descriptor telling me? I will use the product as is, but may not buy it again. I need a product that is less brittle since I’m growing parts with separate and very fine details.
customer_reviews.author: Myles Marcovitch

customer_reviews.title: Works okay and arrived quickly, but...
customer_reviews.text: This resin arrived very quickly and has almost too good bed adhesion, it's quite difficult to remove prints. I've used a few different resins and this has rendered very detailed prints. The bad, the finished product is extremely brittle compared to other resins that I've used. Detailed parts break very easily under stress. Even hand tightening screws will crack the parts. I'll try a few of their other formulas -- but will not be purchasing this particular one again.
customer_reviews.author: Labra

customer_reviews.title: Prints great but still smells
customer_reviews.text: I expect pretty much all of these to smell, it is no better or worse than others, but I am trying hard not to smell any of them. I post cure for 30 minutes, submerged in water, and that works. I have seen other reviews complaining about it being tacky, I had the same issue, prior to submerging the parts. I have not done much tuning but am using an Anycubic Photon Layer 0.03mm exposure 11sec off 4.5sec bottom exposure 80sec bottom layers 6
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Horner

customer_reviews.title: Love the colour of this - a really clear crystal blue.
customer_reviews.text: Elegoo resin is up there with the best of the resins available both for their open Mars machines and for similar mSLA printers. The price is great and the print qualities are gorgeous to look at. Nice and durable prints, great detail and finish. I only wish the resin was available from Amazon Australia, but even with international shipping, the price was competitive with local alternatives. If I'm ever able to ship it to Australia again (thanks COVID!!) I'll definitely buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Gandy

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what it says it is.
customer_reviews.text: Decent resin, does the job it's supposed to. So far feels more flexible than the standard AnyCubic I use. The color is a bit deceptive. I don't know that I'd call this gray as it isn't color neutral otherwise. It's more of a Pantone 2106 C. There's a noticable blue and red tint to the color. It's not bad, but don't expect it to match anything that's actually "gray". This seems like it will work well for miniatures and applications for inside a car. Good price. Overall, good. I give average reviews for an average product. This product does nothing to far exceeds my expectations, and therefore doesn't get a great or amazing rating.
customer_reviews.author: Proteus

customer_reviews.title: Turns yellowish when cured.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a 4 star because there is no way to achieve the white they are depicting, or at least not one that I have found. Using the sun in small short burst, cloudy days, even low powered UV led's yellowed the cured resin. Other than that the stuff is top notch and would recommend if you don't care about the end color of the model. Right off of the build platform of my MARS, the stuff is white as can be! Thanks ELEGOO for great and reliable products!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Price is a bit high
customer_reviews.text: Kinda costly, can flex slightly, detail is great smell is fairly mild works well on clean up no white residue after clean up.. EDIT... So the price has gone through the roof i can get 1000 ml bottle from syraya tech for $9.00 less then 2 bottles of ellgoo abs or should I say ele boo hiss...
customer_reviews.author: A. Myers

customer_reviews.title: It just works!
customer_reviews.text: I just got my first resin printer (Elegoo Mars) 1.5 weeks ago and in the process of ordering, I did some online research and asked what was a good starter resin that would just work right out of the bottle. This resin (Elegoo ABS-like grey resin) was recommended and it has worked great! I bought 3 other colors/types of Elegoo resins and have been reluctant to try them because I'm having such great luck with this one! Every print has come out perfect, except for the one where I didn't do the supports correctly, but it still came out pretty darn good!
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to the resin printing, been using an fdm to make dollhouse miniature for about 3 years. This stuff is SO MUCH EASIER. prints off the elgoo Mars printer with this are so perfect. I can print so tiny and I don’t lose any details! This resin has little smell (I barely smell it but my wife says it’s had an oder after being in the room with it for a while. It prints nice. Cures nicer. Just love it. Bought 2 more when I saw it drop a couple dollars!!
customer_reviews.author: Slvrscoobie

customer_reviews.title: Not as crystal clear as I expected
customer_reviews.text: Still a bit spendy, and I tend to have a "smoked glass" finish on my prints versus the crystal clear their example leads you to believe. Perhaps with a UV curing lamp this sort of glass finish is possible, I've not used it with a curing lamp yet so can only guess. It's a bit pricey for resin, so make sure it meets your printer's requirements and has a color and quality acceptable for your use, in light of my comments.
customer_reviews.author: R. Helms

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR CRAFTING OR ART WORK!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Does not cure crystal clear at all. This resin will cure the color of light amber (pale yellow) regardless of what is stated in the seller's product description. Not useable in projects that require a thicker than 1/32 thickness as to the fact that resin cures from the top down only causing gas bubbles to form from the degassing process of this UV Curing Resin. You can not use the layering technique because this resin will layer like Slate Rock showing visible layers in your project.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Carrasquillo

customer_reviews.title: Not truly transparent on Elegoo Mars
customer_reviews.text: If you want clear prints, and you are using elegoo mars, this is not the resin you want. The 3 frogs are each with different settings, and the only reason the right one is not yellowed is because it has not been cured yet. I purchased this resin to make some frosted glass looking figures and no matter what i do or how they end up being yellow. the best i can do like i said is to NOT post cure them, and keep them out of the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Ryal N. Deveau

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work fine
customer_reviews.text: This was my first bottle I ever bought so I don't have anything against which to compare. I chose this because the price was the lowest I could find and I wanted to learn the basics without breaking the bank. My first model on the Anycubic Photon was a success. Once cured in daylight the color looked much more yellow. Not sure if that is normal. Odor was not fun but as with any resin precautions must be taken.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Korbylo

customer_reviews.title: not sure if amazon is sending old batches of resin or not
customer_reviews.text: I want to start this with pointing out that I have both the transparent resin and the grey resin bottles from elegoo and a bottle of anycubic's grey. I haven't had issue with the transparent resin, but the grey. Even after shaking the resin, its very watery, more so than the anycubic and the elegoo transparent. I've also noticed that the grey resin starts getting white streaks in it as its printing. I've had several failed prints with different models and after changing the resin out to the other brand I haven't had issues or the white streaking.
customer_reviews.author: A. Patel

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and detail for minatures!
customer_reviews.text: This material prints well and has a small amount of flex! I mix Siraya Tech "Tenacious " with ELEGOO ABS-Like resin (clear red and clear blue) in a 1:3 ratio. (IE 1/4 Tenacious) This has allowed me to create models with more than enough flex to keep weapons and legs from breaking when dropped without being overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: TheAtomicSoul

customer_reviews.title: Bad batch?
customer_reviews.text: I've been printing with with SLA resin for the past 6 months and have had successful prints with every other variation of resin except the translucent "clear". I have only purchased resin from this manufacturer - so I know its not an issue with the company. I think something went terribly wrong with this batch of translucent resin. I would appreciate a replacement bottle of functional "clear" resin due to the fact I've spent the past month attempting a plethora of methods to get the resin to work - but sadly I've had no success.
customer_reviews.author: Jonnie P.

customer_reviews.title: prints well, but turns very yellow
customer_reviews.text: So far, all of my prints have come out perfectly, except that curing turns it yellow. Even when under a UV lamp for only a few seconds, it has yellowed. The knight with the sword only cured for 45 seconds. The mage and larger gecko rider were 30 seconds. I only cured the smaller gecko rider for about 10 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Panowicz

customer_reviews.title: Tastes terrible, but prints like a dream.
customer_reviews.text: Using on a regular Photon after getting terrible results from the stock goo. What an upgrade. Better adhesion, great detail. The parts definitely have a nice ABS feel to them...tough, but a little flexible. Definitely do your calibration sheet to get your exposure time down. Good stuff...I'll be getting more.
customer_reviews.author: A. Tanguay

customer_reviews.title: A great resin
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great print quality Easy to calibrate Great color (ABS Blue transparent) Always adheres to build plate Is pretty strong and doesn’t break as easy Cons: The lids on the bottles are prone to cracking if even slightly over tightened. So leave standing & not on side
customer_reviews.author: Savino

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Performance and Color for Figures/Mini's
customer_reviews.text: This is my third bottle of Elegoo Resin. So far ALL of their resins have been low odor and take UV light very well. The settings that I have been using with my Elegoo Mars printer and this resin is : Layer Height: 0.05 mm Bottom Layer Count: 5 Exposure Time: 7 s Bottom Exposure Time: 65 s Light-off Delay: 0 s {both are set to this} I have not had issues with the prints sticking to the bed, nor with supports failing to hold my prints. The details that the resin capture are just astounding as well. This has become my defacto resin of choice and will constantly be in stock at my house.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat! Low odor! Decent price! Prints well!
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with my purchase of Elegoo white resin. I haven't had any failures during the 1/2 liter I have used so far. Pros: • Prints nice • Nice tone of white (IMO) • Low odor • No printing issues Cons: • Not free
customer_reviews.author: Luckyman

customer_reviews.title: Prints well, but yellows instantly
customer_reviews.text: It prints well and fairly quickly given that it's transparent, but the moment I washed the prints off and post-cured them, they yellowed quite dramatically. I was really hoping for a true transparent.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great color for details....
customer_reviews.text: I started with this grey resin when I got my Elegoo Mars printer. It works great!! I like the light grey because you can really see the detail. I'll eventually paint over the gray but for resin cleaning purposes you can see where the left over resin resides on you model so you can further clean it. I can't wait to get the Elegoo water cleaning resin version when it comes to Amazon in November, it'll make cleaning models a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J

customer_reviews.title: This product works OK!
customer_reviews.text: So my first print was Tenacious and second Blu by Sirya Tech, and then moved to this one. It is not as good but still works. I had some issues with layers which might not of been the resin, but it was the only thing that had changed, so I can only assume it was due to settings variance or the material in general. However I am very new to this so I wouldn't take this review too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great resin for a great value.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the best luck with Elegoo resins. I'm also been playing with a few others, but I'm having the most success with the Elegoo ones. I recently purchased a large bottle of Elegoo white and translucent and some different colored dyes to be able to make my own custom colors. When learning a new machine or printing style it's always a good choice to stick with the company available filament or resin. It allows you to use settings that have been verified by the company to work so it removes the guesswork you may experience with other brand resins.
customer_reviews.author: N. Catalfamo

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful results my first attempt!
customer_reviews.text: I got my Anycubic Photon 3 days ago and this is my first print with non_Anycubic resin. I think the results speak for themselves, the print is flawless. It just needs a little cleaning. I may have over-cured the print with UV giving it a slight yellowish tint. Normally the resin is robin's-egg blue.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in Iowa

customer_reviews.title: Great resin, at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Easy cleanup - excess rapidly washes of the print in a container of alcohol. No need for a dangerous ultrasonic tank. A little swishing around, in the container and it is clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Member

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issue?
customer_reviews.text: The other reviews say this product is great, so maybe I just have a dud. I cannot get it to harden fully. I've tried under two different uv bulbs and tested a small bit sitting in the summer sun all day. Not really sure what the deal is. Its possible that it is user error, but I think my batch is just not right.
customer_reviews.author: Joshdog85

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with an EPAX printer with their provided configuration file.
customer_reviews.text: First time resin printing so had little prior experience besides using a traditional 3d printer from Dagoma. Print quality on my Epax X1 speaks for itself. My first print was a miniature for table top gaming but I didn't prep the size right. Be that as it may, I had no adhesion issues to speak of with the small print. Set the miniature next to my previous 3d print off my Neva from Dagoma in the picture for reference as well as next to a penny for size. Printed the resin one at .02 mm with the Epax configuration preset they have for Elegoo resin and more than satisfied. I'll let the photos speak for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Winston

customer_reviews.title: Made the change and not going back.
customer_reviews.text: OK, so I read articles saying this stuff was better than the other resins and all you have to do is change some settings. I use the base model Anycubic printer for detailed figures for table top games. First off, With the Anycubic resins, there was a 50/50 chance, part of my print would unhook from the plate and cause the print to be warped or have parts that stuck to the plastic screen. I've used 3,000nm of this resin so far and had 0 bad prints. (I have had some wood-grains peel but mostly because my supports bypassed them) I've only used the grey so far, but I'm purchasing translucent today. I'm hoping for the same results.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Never get a bad one!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Elegoo Gray for over 6 months now. It is an excellent resin for the Photon. I use 3, 60 second bottom layers and the adhesion is excellent. It provides my prints with excellent detail at 12 second per .05 layer. I would recommend this resin if you are looking for ease of use, and print quality.
customer_reviews.author: Milton M.

customer_reviews.title: Success with Elegoo products!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Elegoo Mars printer and this Elegoo rapid grey resin. First print was a success. Surface is smooth with no layer lines even at 50μ. Previously with the Wanhao D7 and Monocure rapid grey resin, I had ALL prints failing no matter how much I researched and experimented. Plus I spent a whole lot less with Elegoo.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice resin for printing minis on Anycubic Photon
customer_reviews.text: I've had solid results with this resin on my Photon. Using settings suggested on Photonsters spreadsheet. Gaslands scale miniatures still on supports in first photo, 28mm fantasy figs on FDM printed bases in 2nd photo. I normally print 28mm minis without bases. Makes it easier to print and remove supports. I base them later, sometimes using just plain PLA FDM printed bases.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Keane

customer_reviews.title: Awesome resin for 3d printing
customer_reviews.text: I have rried many types of resin, and so far this is my go to one for printing miniatures. The detail is awesome, it actually stays adhered to the build plate, but pops off when I want to remove it. It also cleans up really well. All around great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: greendragon

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Cure
customer_reviews.text: Once I found the "cheat sheet" for my printer settings with this resin, things slid in just fine. However, I lost several prints to poor adhesion of the layers even when things were dialed in. You'll be quadrupling your lamp exposure times at the very least. Once successfully printed, prints that would usually cure in 4-5 minutes under my lamp with my other resins took upwards to an hour and a half. Pain in the butt. Still, if you're willing to be patient, go for it. The prints look GREAT - they just need a lot of TLC.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Great resin
customer_reviews.text: First time 3d printer here. Works great. I read a lot and watched a lot of YouTube videos warning about the smell. I use it in my garage with all the doors closed and can't smell it. I would recommend getting a funnel when pouring the resin back into the bottle. One last thing Don't forget the PAPER TOWELS!!!
customer_reviews.author: adahlberg

customer_reviews.title: Not a great transparent look.
customer_reviews.text: As a resin, after running a couple of calibrations to see exposure time, 6~10 seconds so I settled at 8. It’s been printing great for me. And out of the printer it is fairly transparent, but after alcohol and curing it is a transparent yellow, like plastic left in the sun for years. I will look at their other colors, prints are great, it is cheap, but if looking for a transparent as a final product is your thing...choose something else.
customer_reviews.author: Paxx

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for everyday resin
customer_reviews.text: Elegoo's resins are the right combination of price and performance. They're simple to use and don't require an extra accommodations to get great quality and perhaps (to some) most importantly, they're low/no odor. I've purchased a few colors and they've all worked well, they also come well packaged in a padded pouch thingy inside a box so there is little chance of damage during shipment. Elegoo resin has become my default choice for standard resin, my only wish is that they'll continue to expand the color options!
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Great resin at a good price
customer_reviews.text: My new printer came with a small amount of resin so I knew I needed an extra bottle. This is my first experience with resin printing so I wasn't positive what I was looking for. I went with this brand because of the cost and so far I have had great quality prints with it as well!
customer_reviews.author: mxtr185

customer_reviews.title: Parts yellow when cured
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to make a chess set from this resin, especially after seeing frosted parts in reviews. My parts are yellowing when cured, leading to a discoloring of the part.
customer_reviews.author: T.H.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic stuff
customer_reviews.text: This elegoo clear resin yellows if I expose it to uv too long, but a water bath cure followed by a good uv resistant shiny clear coat makes this clear resin work fantastic. It's not brittle either, which is good when I accidentally drop a print.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy H.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product - SLIGHTLY brittle
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this 5 stars because it prints so well, the only downside is the brittleness of the resin, I have has many minis break at the legs or feet area, I started mixing this with siraya Blu for insane print quality and good levels of durability
customer_reviews.author: Curtis & Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good Resin, Color will affect print.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this resin twice once in red and once in grey. Both resins print really well but seem to have differently quality after prints are done. The red resin seems to cure a lot faster under a UV lamp or sun than the grey resin does. The grey resin seems soft after curing and can take a day for it to stiffen up. Overall I'm very pleased with it. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is due to inconsistency in the curing based on color.
customer_reviews.author: N. Germon

customer_reviews.title: Does not cure clear at all
customer_reviews.text: Adhered fine, They were translucent while printing but basically turned orange the moment uv light hit it. Going to keep trying but very let down over it not being remotely clear.
customer_reviews.author: Joleme

customer_reviews.title: This resin works perfectly with the Elegoo Mars Printer
customer_reviews.text: The resin produces highly detailed parts that are easy to shape/sand using conventional sanding/filing techniques. You can cure them under a UV light or leave them in a window exposed to sunlight. When fully cured I can detect no difference between these parts and other cast resin detail sets I have purchased for model detailing.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Good printing overall but maybe I received an old bottle
customer_reviews.text: After months of printing with different colors, grey was better. However, I do not know if I received an older bottle because I was getting brittle prints and the worst smell I've experienced in my life. It got stuck to my shop for days, so I printed once per month. I have not seen other reviews where they comment on the terrible smell, but it was close to burnt rubber
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Beltrán

customer_reviews.title: Just works.
customer_reviews.text: There is not much you can say, it works. I use the gray as I then paint it. You do have to expose the printed material to UV light. I have UV proof eyewear so I use a UV lamp. You could just put it in the sun for a while, but this is Oregon and we don't get a lot of UV here ;-) Must harden up. Just works! Use protection.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Wild

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 colors. ABS-Like Transparent Red which always prints great. Black which I can't seem to find the happy spot but it does print good. ABS-Like White, now this is where it gets interesting. The white was not the one I ordered. It starts to seperate in the vat after about an hour to 2 hours worth of printing. It prints good but it seperating makes me worry about print failures. I do highly recommend the ABS-Like Transparent Red.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Gasser

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if its me or the resin
customer_reviews.text: Sorry for the 1 star, but even after using almost double the exposure that is labeled on this item I still cannot get it to print. Have been trying for about a week, and nothing has even solidified in the vat(have cleaned vat between tries). I am using the wanhao d7 plus. I am new to sla printing but still have not been able to print with this resin. If anyone can reply with what they had for settings and got prints, it would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Very inconsistent quality in product
customer_reviews.text: Ive had two experiences with this product. I bought a couple of bottles that printed really well. But recently they changed the formula or something because for the life of me I cant get it to print. At first I thought it was me. But I have a black light I use to help harden after a print. I put what I had under there and instead of a slight glow like with previous bottles, this stuff lights up like a flashligt. So something in the formula is off. Buy if you want, just know it might not work out.
customer_reviews.author: RickyP

customer_reviews.title: Multiple Prints - No Failures
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this product is amazing. I am a new 3d Resin printer and having a product that just works and works the first time helped me through the learning curve. I'm impressed with the quality of the resin - the formulation works very well in the elegoo mars 3d printer. I am very happy and have reordered multiple times!
customer_reviews.author: George E. Bridges II

customer_reviews.title: Great Resin! Only buy Elegoo Mars Resin for the Elegoo Mars Printer.
customer_reviews.text: It's always best to get the resin which was formulated for the printer you have. This stuff is awesome. Once you get the right settings dialed in, you will not be disappointed with the results. Great Resin!
customer_reviews.author: Iamgadgetman

customer_reviews.title: Very dependable, no problems, ever!
customer_reviews.text: I'm sticking with the Elegoo resins because I can count on them to deliver consistent results. The detail is superb, and all things considered, very low odor. Prints drain quickly and clean up in IPA 99% is fast. Shipping and packaging are great, never had a problem. If you need a great go-to resin at a reasonable price stick with Elegoo.
customer_reviews.author: arthouse-studio

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: For the price I expected this resin to have an odor most foul, but I was pleasantly surprised to find out it has very little smell at all. The adhesion has been pretty good. I've only had one failed print in the past week from the model not sticking to the build plate.
customer_reviews.author: MoldyHacker

customer_reviews.title: Love this resin
customer_reviews.text: The first type of resin I picked up was a clear and that one was a bit more persnickety. I decided to try the grey and man do I like this stuff. It is smooth and clean and works well for minis. I will buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Great quality prints, fantastic price.
customer_reviews.text: I use a sparkmaker fhd. I bought some sparkmaker resin when I ordered my printer. That stuff never looked as good as this goo. It is also a quarter of the price. I will be using this exclusively.
customer_reviews.author: A Real Guy

customer_reviews.title: Consistent
customer_reviews.text: So far the best resin for consistency. I have printed this mostly at 50 microns, but have done a few at 20. The grey color is great for miniatures, painting is not necessary if you don't mind monochrome playing peices.
customer_reviews.author: CodeWarriorMalo

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner resin with great results!
customer_reviews.text: First resin and never had a major problem. I was worried about the smell but it didn't bother me at all, the IPA used to clean the prints was stronger. Print quality is great. I used the settings on the bottle with an elegoo Mars printer and everything was super easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Absalon Prieto

customer_reviews.title: Great resin... when they have it in stock
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely no complaints about the resin itself. Out of the 18 different brands/colors I have used in the past year, this one is the best. Too bad they can't keep it instock
customer_reviews.author: W. M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Nothing But Issues
customer_reviews.text: Switched from Anycubic Green to the Elegoo Grey and have had issues ever since. Ran the resin exposure test on my Photon and have tried everything from 2 to 20s exposure with results similar to those pictured. Yes I made sure to shake my bottle well and filter my resin. Kind of disappointed, so I'll probably switch back to anycubic resin.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Can't Beat the Value
customer_reviews.text: One of the best color options for this ABS-lile resin. Had some difficulty with clear that didn't happen with this red-tinted version. Plenty of detail. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: SUBDSGNR

customer_reviews.title: Like a dream
customer_reviews.text: Used other "ABS Like" resins - this one is the best. Generally, all Elegoo products are superior, and I've tried just about everything. I've ordered like 4 1kg jugs of this stuff - wouldn't trust my final project to anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Meier

customer_reviews.title: Brittle, sticky, warps, and turns yellow(supposed to be clear)
customer_reviews.text: Idk if i got a bad batch or what, but it turns yellow(I ordered clear) when cured, stays sticky, warps a bunch(like it literally runs from the light?!?!?!), and is insanely brittle. I'm highly disappointed in this.
customer_reviews.author: megan lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic and Dependable
customer_reviews.text: I've been primarily using the Elegoo grey and translucent offerings, and they've both performed fantastically. The translucent resin requires layer contact times of 12 to 16 seconds, so this really increases the time it takes to produce parts, but the results are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P. Durkin

customer_reviews.title: Clear is actually a poorly hydrated yellow
customer_reviews.text: Clear resin is not clear. It comes out of the printer clear and then if you try to cure it at all it turns a nice nurgles rot yellow... not what i purchased. I purchased a clear resin. If you would like a clear resin look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Best resin I have used so far
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Photon for over a year now. It sat unused for 6 months because the resins were too expensive and too smelly. Both those complaints and more are solved with Elegoo's resin. The odor is minimal, the prints come out great, the color is spot on, and the price is great. This is now my goto resin for the Anycubic Photon.
customer_reviews.author: Shea

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful transparent blue.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, resin set well and adhered great. Printed a little longer due to the transparency of the blue just to make sure it stuck. Prints have been awesome. Mixed with some left over gray which turned the resin to a frost blue which also looked great. Will definately pick up some more.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy L. Ott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, nearly odor-free resin at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Elegoo resins are great value for money. They are far less than many other resins and perform very well. I have been using the white, translucent, and gray resins mostly. They all print very good resolution (I have found that the translucent captures fine detail the best) and they print predictably and reliably. One of the best features too, is that the Elegoo resins have hardly any odor at all. On top of all that, they are a bargain price too.
customer_reviews.author: Drdds

customer_reviews.title: Great general purpose resin
customer_reviews.text: I used this resin to print several items on my ElegoMars printer. It performed very well and was forgiving of some minor software glitches.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Poletto

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and functional
customer_reviews.text: Elegoo resins are always great. They work well and work first time. Hard to go wrong with Elegoo resin. (For the record, I use an Elegoo Mars 3D printer).
customer_reviews.author: M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is as very nice resin and prints very well, I'm going to be making icicles with this resin very soon I've used it to make a few miniatures and that's about it so far...
customer_reviews.author: Harlyn

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this stuff too much!! Great quality for your money. I’m afraid to say that because I’m hoping the price stays so affordable! Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My go to resin!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few different resin types for creating minis and this has become my go to resin. Never had any issues with the quality, consistency, packaging, or any other factor. I see myself using this for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced resin that works and w/o the strong stench of other SLA resins!
customer_reviews.text: The headline says it all. I'm a chemist and the stench of other resins I've used made SLA printing unpleasant. This resin sticks, looks great and produces great prints.
customer_reviews.author: M H

customer_reviews.title: Great printing quality at a very affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I tried this one and prints out absolutely fine, no blobs, no failed adhesion, no problems at all. The printing quality is superb and compared with other resins I've used I liked it very much. The best part is the price, nearly half the others.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo R.

customer_reviews.title: The resin just works. thats it.
customer_reviews.text: At this point I have used a number of different resins all with their ups and downs. But this one is my favorite so far, good quality and details, but not SO hard that any cleanup sanding takes ages. No cracks so far on my hollowed out prints.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Blown away.
customer_reviews.text: Alright so i just purchased my elegoo mars a month ago. I ordered this resin on accident and was upset when i realized this was ABS like resin. (i went on to order the regular resin later on too test to). However with the print quality with this resin is giving me amazing prints so i have yet to use the regular stuff i received. I would definitively recommend this resin with the elegoo!
customer_reviews.author: Lando L

customer_reviews.title: Great Resin!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't been printing with resin very long, but when I first tried it out it was with another company's resin and the smell was so strong it gave me sinus issues, so I was nervous to try it out again. So far Elegoo resin has been fantastic! I can barely smell it at all. The customer service has been wonderful and it prints great too!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Adams

product_meta.title: ELEGOO ABS-Like 3D Rapid Resin LCD UV-Curing Resin 405nm Standard Photopolymer Resin for LCD 3D Printing Clear Blue 1000g
feature_bullets: 【Low Shrinkage and High Precision】ELEGOO photopolymer resin is specially designed for reducing volume shrinkage during the Photocuring process ,which ensures the high precision of the print model with smooth finish.

【Fast Curing and Great Stability】ELEGOO 405nm Rapid Resin was designed to significantly reduce printing time with its excellent fluidity. Meanwhile its great stability and proper hardness guarantee a worry-free printing experience and successful printing.

【Bright and Stunning Colors】: With high quality pigments and photo-initiators inside ELEGOO UV-Curing resin, the models printed with resin have a very pure and stunning color effect just like an artwork.
【Wide Applications】Given the outstanding performances, ELEGOO standard resin is suitable for most DLP/LCD 3D printers. Works best with the LCD 3D Printers.
【Safe and Secure Packaging】Leak-proof bottle fully wrapped with a plastic bubble bag and exquisite designed package box make sure the resin stays in place where they belong

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
